title: Afrojack, Martin Garrix, David Guetta, & Amél Unleash Generational Collab "Our Time"
description: Now available on Spinnin' Records, the long-anticipated track captures a rare moment of unity between global icons and a rising star.
author: Ansh Talim
excerpt: Now available on Spinnin' Records, the long-anticipated track captures a rare moment of unity between global icons and a rising star.
siteName: EDM.com - The Latest Electronic Dance Music News, Reviews & Artists
text: Afrojack, Martin Garrix, and David Guetta have released their first-ever track together, joining forces with rising producer Amél on the new single, "Our Time," out now via Spinnin' Records.Despite the artists' long-standing friendships and frequent intersections behind the scenes, this marks the first time all three have come together on an official release. The track first made its debut at AMF during Amsterdam Dance Event, with Afrojack and Garrix teasing an early version to a packed arena. More recently, all four artists appeared live onstage at Ushuaïa Ibiza during Guetta's "F**k Me I’m Famous" residency, offering fans a glimpse into the chemistry behind the project. It's a union steeped in history but driven by a forward-facing spirit."I'm incredibly proud to be part of this project and to have our lives intertwined the way they are. This release brings together four generations – it's a story that represents all of us, from where we started to where we are now. This is our time," says Afrojack.That multigenerational touch is evident all throughout the record. With Amél handling key parts of the production, his presence injects a fresh, creative angle without disrupting the shared identity at the core. The result is a track that doesn't aim to relive the past, but instead builds directly upon it, channeling the essence of peak EDM into a sound shaped for today."I'm really grateful the four of us came together for this track, it's a perfect example of what a great collaboration can be. I love how it all evolved, from the original demo and chord changes to the final result. I'm truly proud of what we've created," Martin Garrix reflects.David Guetta shares that: “Even though it was sometimes difficult to coordinate our busy schedules and since we’re all in different parts of the world – we still made it work. What really stood out to me was how dedicated everyone was. Even when we were on stage together, playing the mix, we were still focused on making it better, down to the vocal details. That level of commitment says everything."Scroll to ContinueRecommended ArticlesThere's a deliberate nod to the early 2010s baked into the sound design. Crisp percussion and a soaring lead synth come together in a mix that feels increasingly euphoric as the track goes on. Each producer's signature touch surfaces in the arrangement, but the final product holds together with clarity and purpose. "A few years ago, this was just a dream. Working with any of you felt so out of reach – and then Afrojack discovered me. To be here now, doing this, feels surreal. I'm incredibly grateful and so excited for what’s to come," says Amél.You can listen to "Our Time" below and find the new release on streaming platforms here.FOLLOW AFROJACK:X: x.com/afrojackInstagram: instagram.com/afrojackTikTok: tiktok.com/@afrojackFacebook: facebook.com/djafrojackSpotify: spoti.fi/2B06Di0FOLLOW MARTIN GARRIX:X: x.com/martingarrixInstagram: instagram.com/martingarrixTikTok: tiktok.com/@martingarrixFacebook: facebook.com/martin.garrixSpotify: spoti.fi/2YszVxQFOLLOW DAVID GUETTA:X: x.com/davidguettaInstagram: instagram.com/davidguettaTikTok: tiktok.com/@davidguettaFacebook: facebook.com/davidguettaSpotify: spoti.fi/3fHbpACFOLLOW AMÉL:Instagram: instagram.com/amelmusicofficialSpotify: bit.ly/4eC5ThG
html:
Afrojack, Martin Garrix, and David Guetta have released their first-ever track together, joining forces with rising producer Amél on the new single, "Our Time," out now via Spinnin' Records.

Despite the artists' long-standing friendships and frequent intersections behind the scenes, this marks the first time all three have come together on an official release. The track first made its debut at AMF during Amsterdam Dance Event, with Afrojack and Garrix teasing an early version to a packed arena. More recently, all four artists appeared live onstage at Ushuaïa Ibiza during Guetta's "F**k Me I’m Famous" residency, offering fans a glimpse into the chemistry behind the project. It's a union steeped in history but driven by a forward-facing spirit.

"I'm incredibly proud to be part of this project and to have our lives intertwined the way they are. This release brings together four generations – it's a story that represents all of us, from where we started to where we are now. This is our time," says Afrojack.

That multigenerational touch is evident all throughout the record. With Amél handling key parts of the production, his presence injects a fresh, creative angle without disrupting the shared identity at the core. The result is a track that doesn't aim to relive the past, but instead builds directly upon it, channeling the essence of peak EDM into a sound shaped for today.

"I'm really grateful the four of us came together for this track, it's a perfect example of what a great collaboration can be. I love how it all evolved, from the original demo and chord changes to the final result. I'm truly proud of what we've created," Martin Garrix reflects.

David Guetta shares that: “Even though it was sometimes difficult to coordinate our busy schedules and since we’re all in different parts of the world – we still made it work. What really stood out to me was how dedicated everyone was. Even when we were on stage together, playing the mix, we were still focused on making it better, down to the vocal details. That level of commitment says everything."

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

There's a deliberate nod to the early 2010s baked into the sound design. Crisp percussion and a soaring lead synth come together in a mix that feels increasingly euphoric as the track goes on. Each producer's signature touch surfaces in the arrangement, but the final product holds together with clarity and purpose.

"A few years ago, this was just a dream. Working with any of you felt so out of reach – and then Afrojack discovered me. To be here now, doing this, feels surreal. I'm incredibly grateful and so excited for what’s to come," says Amél.

You can listen to "Our Time" below and find the new release on streaming platforms here.
